qas.question: When did the advent of the Jewish Enlightenment occur?
What was a result of the Jewish Enlightenment?
Name a Jewish community that disappeared entirely?
Where did assimilation never take place?
What Jewish community has never disappeared?
What encouraged Jews to not participate in secular society?
What has not been caused by Jews assimilating?

context: Since at least the time of the Ancient Greeks, a proportion of Jews have assimilated into the wider non-Jewish society around them, by either choice or force, ceasing to practice Judaism and losing their Jewish identity. Assimilation took place <b3_0>in all areas<b3_0/>, and during all time periods, with some Jewish communities, for example the <a2_0><b4_0>Kaifeng Jews of China<b4_0/><a2_0/>, disappearing entirely. The advent of <b5_0>the Jewish Enlightenment<b5_0/> of the <a0_0>18th century<a0_0/> (see Haskalah) and the subsequent emancipation of the Jewish populations of Europe and America in the 19th century, accelerated the situation, encouraging Jews to increasingly participate in, and become part of, secular society. The result has been a <a1_0>growing trend of assimilation<a1_0/>, as <b6_0>Jews marry non-Jewish spouses<b6_0/> and stop participating in the Jewish community.
